title: Who Framed Roger Rabbit
desc: This is based on the 1981 novel Who Censored Roger Rabbit? by Gary K. Wolf.

title: Rosemary’s Baby
desc: This is based on the 1967 novel of the same name by Ira Levin.

title: What Dreams May Come
desc: This is based on the 1978 novel of the same name by Richard Matheson.

title: Jackie Brown
desc: This is based on the 1992 novel Rum Punch by Elmore Leonard.

title: The Last of the Mohicans
desc: This is based on the 1826 novel The Last of the Mohicans: A Narrative of 1757 by James Fenimore Cooper.

title: The Princess Diaries
desc: This is based on the 2000 young adult novel of the same name by Meg Cabot.

title: Deliverance
desc: This is based on the 1970 novel of the same name by James Dickey.

title: We Need to Talk About Kevin
desc: This is based on the 2003 novel of the same name by Lionel Shriver.

title: Dances with Wolves
desc: This is based on the 1988 novel of the same name by Michael Blake.

title: Misery
desc: This is based on the 1987 novel of the same name by Stephen King.

title: God’s Not Dead
desc: This is based on the book God's Not Dead: Evidence for God in an Age of Uncertainty by Rice Broocks.

title: America: Imagine the World Without Her
desc: This is based on the 2014 book of the same name by Dinesh D'Souza.

title: Paddington
desc: This is based on the children's literary character Paddington Bear, created by Michael Bond in 1958.

title: Unbroken
desc: This is based on the 2010 non-fiction book Unbroken: A World War II Story of Survival, Resilience, and Redemption by Laura Hillenbrand.

title: A Most Wanted Man
desc: This is based on the 2008 novel of the same name by John le Carré.

title: Left Behind
desc: This is based on the 1995 novel Left Behind: A Novel of the Earth's Last Days by Tim LaHaye and Jerry B. Jenkins.

title: The Best of Me
desc: This is based on the 2011 novel of the same name by Nicholas Sparks.

title: Men, Women & Children
desc: This is based on the 2011 novel of the same name by Chad Kultgen.

title: Before I Go to Sleep
desc: This is based on the 2011 novel of the same name by S. J. Watson.

title: Night at the Museum
desc: This is based on the 1993 children's book The Night at the Museum by Milan Trenc.

title: John Dies at the End
desc: This is based on the 2007 novel of the same name by David Wong.

title: The Indian in the Cupboard
desc: This is based on the 1980 children's book of the same name by Lynne Reid Banks.

title: Stir of Echoes
desc: This is based on the 1958 novel A Stir of Echoes by Richard Matheson.

title: Phantoms
desc: This is based on the 1983 novel of the same name by Dean Koontz.

title: Left Behind
desc: This is based on the 1995 novel Left Behind: A Novel of the Earth's Last Days by Tim LaHaye and Jerry B. Jenkins.

title: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
desc: This is based on the 1886 novel The Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde by Robert Louis Stevenson.

title: Tom and Huck
desc: This is based on the 1876 novel The Adventures of Tom Sawyer by Mark Twain.

title: Pinocchio
desc: This is based on the 1883 children's novel The Adventures of Pinocchio by Carlo Collodi.

desc: This is based on the 1883 children's novel The Adventures of Pinocchio by Carlo Collodi.

title: The Adventures of Pinocchio
desc: This is based on the 1883 children's novel of the same name by Carlo Collodi.

title: 101 Dalmatians
desc: This is based on the 1956 novel The Hundred and One Dalmatians by Dodie Smith.

title: One Hundred and One Dalmatians
desc: This is based on the 1956 novel The Hundred and One Dalmatians by Dodie Smith.

title: The Apple Dumpling Gang
desc: This is based on the 1971 novel of the same name by Jack Bickham.

title: Babe
desc: This is based on the 1983 novel The Sheep-Pig by Dick King-Smith (also known as Babe: The Gallant Pig in the US).

title: The Baby-Sitters Club
desc: This is based on the novel series of the same name by Ann M. Martin, first published in 1986.

title: Babar: The Movie
desc: This is based on the children's literary character Babar the Elephant, created in 1931 by Jean de Brunhoff.

title: Black Beauty
desc: This is based on the 1877 novel of the same name by Anna Sewell.

title: The Borrowers
desc: This is loosely based on the 1952 children's novel of the same name by Mary Norton.

title: The Secret World of Arrietty
desc: This is based on the 1952 children's novel The Borrowers by Mary Norton.

title: The Cat in the Hat
desc: This is based on the 1957 children's book of the same name by Dr. Seuss.

title: The Cheetah Girls
desc: This is based on the book series of the same name by Deborah Gregory, first published in 1999.

title: Doctor Dolittle
desc: This is based on the novel series by Hugh Lofting, combining three of the books The Story of Doctor Dolittle, Being the History of His Peculiar Life at Home and Astonishing Adventures in Foreign Parts (1920), The Voyages of Doctor Dolittle (1922), and Doctor Dolittle's Circus (1924) together.

title: Dumbo
desc: This is based upon the 1941 Roll-a-Book of the same name by Helen Aberson and Harold Pearl.

title: Harriet the Spy
desc: This is based on the 1964 novel of the same name by Louise Fitzhugh.

title: Little Women
desc: This is based on the 1868 novel of the same name by Louisa May Alcott.

title: Little Women
desc: This is based on the 1868 novel of the same name by Louisa May Alcott.

title: Secret Window
desc: This is based on the 1990 novella Secret Window, Secret Garden by Stephen King.

title: The Secret Garden
desc: This is based on the 1911 novel of the same name by Frances Hodgson Burnett.

title: Madeline
desc: This is based on the children's book series of the same name created in 1939 by Ludwig Bemelmans.

title: Treasure Island
desc: This is based on the 1883 novel of the same name by Robert Louis Stevenson.

title: Muppet Treasure Island
desc: This is based on the 1883 novel Treasure Island by Robert Louis Stevenson.

title: Treasure Planet
desc: This is based on the 1883 novel Treasure Island by Robert Louis Stevenson.

title: Homeward Bound: The Incredible Journey
desc: This is based on the 1961 novel The Incredible Journey by Sheila Burnford.

title: The Iron Giant
desc: This is based on the 1968 novel The Iron Man by Ted Hughes (published in the US as The Iron Giant).

title: My Dog Skip
desc: This is based on the 1995 autobiographical memoir of the same name by Willie Morris.

title: Pippi Longstocking
desc: This is based on the children's book series of the same name, created in 1945 by Astrid Lindgren.

title: The New Adventures of Pippi Longstocking
desc: This is based on the children's book series Pippi Longstocking, created in 1945 by Astrid Lindgren.

title: The Secret of NIMH
desc: This is based on the 1971 children's novel Mrs. Frisby and the Rats of NIMH by Robert C. O'Brien.

title: Stuart Little
desc: This is loosely based on the 1945 novel of the same name by E.B. White.

title: Tuck Everlasting
desc: This is based on the 1975 book of the same name by Natalie Babbitt.

title: Tuck Everlasting
desc: This is based on the 1975 book of the same name by Natalie Babbitt.

title: We’re Back! A Dinosaur’s Story
desc: This is based on the 1987 children's book of the same name by Hudson Talbott .

title: The Wind in the Willows
desc: This is is based on the 1908 novel of the same name by Kenneth Grahame,

title: A Wrinkle in Time
desc: This is based on the 1962 novel of the same name by Madeleine L'Engle.

title: Zenon: Girl of the 21st Century
desc: This is based on the 1997 book of the same name by Marilyn Sadler and Roger Bollen.

title: 9½ Weeks
desc: This is based on the 1978 memoir Nine and a Half Weeks: A Memoir of a Love Affair by Ingeborg Day.

title: Adaptation.
desc: This is based on the 1998 non-fiction book The Orchid Thief by Susan Orlean.

title: Alive
desc: This is based on the 1974 non-fiction book Alive: The Story of the Andes Survivors by Piers Paul Read.

title: All the President’s Men
desc: This is based on the 1974 non-fiction book of the same name by Carl Bernstein and Bob Woodward.

title: Awakenings
desc: This is based on the 1973 memoir of the same name by Oliver Sacks.

title: The Basketball Diaries
desc: This is based on the 1978 autobiographical novel by the same name by Jim Carroll.

title: Argo
desc: This is based on the 1999 book The Master of Disguise: My Secret Life in the CIA by Tony Mendez and the 2007 Wired article "The Great Escape: How the CIA Used a Fake Sci-Fi Flick to Rescue Americans from Tehran" by Joshuah Bearman.

title: Primary Colors
desc: This is based on the 1996 novel Primary Colors: A Novel of Politics by Joe Klein (originally published anonymously).

title: A Civil Action
desc: This is based on the 1995 non-fiction book of the same name by Jonathan Harr.

title: Confessions of a Dangerous Mind
desc: This is based on the 1984 memoir of the same name by Chuck Barris.

title: Dead Man Walking
desc: This is based on the 1993 non-fiction book of the same name by Sister Helen Prejean C.S.J.

title: Fast Food Nation
desc: This is loosely based on the 2001 non-fiction book of the same name by Eric Schlosser.

title: The Fifth Estate
desc: This is based on the 2011 non-fiction books Inside WikiLeaks: My Time with Julian Assange at the World's Most Dangerous Website by Daniel Domscheit-Berg and WikiLeaks: Inside Julian Assange's War on Secrecy by David Leigh and Luke Harding.

title: Freakonomics
desc: This is based on the 2005 book Freakonomics: A Rogue Economist Explores the Hidden Side of Everything by Steven D. Levitt and Stephen J. Dubner.

title: Friday Night Lights
desc: This is based on the 1990 non-fiction book Friday Night Lights: A Town, a Team, and a Dream by H. G. Bissinger.

title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
desc: This is based on the 2002 non-fiction book The Greatest Game Ever Played: Harry Vardon, Francis Ouimet, and the Birth of Modern Golf by Mark Frost.

title: Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Sex *But Were Afraid to Ask
desc: This is loosely inspired by the 1969 non-fiction book of the same name by David Reuben.

title: North Country
desc: This is based on the 2002 non-fiction book Class Action: The Story of Lois Jenson and the Landmark Case That Changed Sexual Harassment Law by Clara Bingham and Laura Leedy Gansler.

title: Seabiscuit
desc: This is based on the 1999 non-fiction book Seabiscuit: An American Legend by Laura Hillenbrand.

title: The Serpent and the Rainbow
desc: This is loosely based on the 1985 non-fiction book The Serpent and the Rainbow: A Harvard Scientist's Astonishing Journey into the Secret Societies of Haitian Voodoo, Zombies, and Magic by Wade Davis.

title: Seven Years in Tibet
desc: This is based on the 1952 autobiographical travel book Seven Years in Tibet: My Life Before, During and After by Heinrich Harrer.

title: Thirteen Days
desc: This is based on the 1997 non-fiction book The Kennedy Tapes: Inside the White House During the Cuban Missile Crisis by Ernest May and Philip Zelikow.

title: The Stepford Wives
desc: This is based on the 1972 novel of the same name by Ira Levin.

title: The Stepford Wives
desc: This is based on the 1972 novel of the same name by Ira Levin.

title: Village of the Damned
desc: This is based on the 1957 novel The Midwich Cuckoos by John Wyndham.

title: Village of the Damned
desc: This is based on the 1957 novel The Midwich Cuckoos by John Wyndham.

title: Devil’s Knot
desc: This is based on the 2002 non-fiction book Devil's Knot: The True Story of the West Memphis Three by Mara Leveritt.

title: Kill the Messenger
desc: This is based on the 2006 non-fiction book Kill the Messenger: How the CIA's Crack-cocaine Controversy Destroyed Journalist Gary Webb by Nick Schou and the 1998 non-fiction book Dark Alliance: The CIA, the Contras, and the Crack Cocaine Explosion by Gary Webb, which was based on Webb's three-part article series "Dark Alliance" originally published in the San Jose Mercury News in August 1996.

title: The Running Man
desc: This is very loosely based on the 1982 novel of the same name by Stephen King (originally published under the pseudonym Richard Bachman).

title: The Revenant
desc: This is based on the 2002 novel The Revenant: A Novel of Revenge by Michael Punke, which was in turn based on the 1915 poem The Song of Hugh Glass by John G. Neihardt.

title: The Big Short
desc: This is based on the 2010 non-fiction book The Big Short: Inside the Doomsday Machine by Michael Lewis.

title: The Danish Girl
desc: This is based on the 2000 novel of the same name by David Ebershoff.

title: Pan
desc:
This is based on the literary character Peter Pan created by J.M. Barrie in 1902.

A list of adaptations can be found here.

title: Carol
desc: This is based on the 1952 novel The Price of Salt by Patricia Highsmith (republished as Carol in 1990).

title: Room
desc: This is based on the 2010 novel of the same name by Emma Donoghue.
